column4: So it looks like apt-get install of sun java6 sdk trashes Ubuntu, both server and client.  Does anyone know about this?
So it looks like apt-get install of sun java6 sdk trashes Ubuntu, both server and client.  Does anyone know about this?
Man, it really has admin on my two machines at a halt.  Is this a known problem?
installing java does not issue a halt command
no it doesn't
if you have a problem, please be specific, don't exagerate
please define "broken"
ok - that's not broken, you need to remove that lock file
I would have thought the java installs would have been well tested.
it's nothing to do with java
you have a lock file in place
stop saying java installs are "hosed" explain the problem
if you exagerate the problem, or don't give details, we can't help
Dialog box is the right thing to say I believe.  It was where it asked permissions.
you need to use tab to navigate around the dialog and accept the license
<tab>.  I believe I tried that.  I can try again.  What about synaptic.  It just froze on my laptop.
reboot your laptop and try again, you probably missed the dialog gui
Sounds like they could do a better job of that.  I better install it from shell next time.
no - hundreeds / thousands of other people don't have an issue with this
it works fine
look at the bug reports - thousands of people have no proble, yet you are the first to report this....I wonder if it's java.....or you ?
